meanings.definition: Outwiles (verb): to surpass in cunning or deceit
meanings.sent1: The sly fox managed to outwiles the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outwiles her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon attempted to outwiles the clever squirrel in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was able to outwiles his victims with his smooth talk and false promises.
meanings.sent5: In the fable, the clever tortoise outwiles the boastful hare in the race.

meanings.definition: Outwiles (adjective): having the ability to outsmart or outmaneuver others
meanings.sent1: The cunning detective had an outwiles mind that could solve any case.
meanings.sent2: She possessed an outwiles strategy that always helped her win games.
meanings.sent3: The outwiles cat managed to catch the elusive mouse with ease.
meanings.sent4: His outwiles nature made him a formidable opponent in any competition.
meanings.sent5: The outwiles owl could spot its prey from far away with its keen eyesight.

meanings.definition: Outwiles (adverb): in a manner that outsmarts or outmaneuvers others
meanings.sent1: She played the game outwiles, always staying one step ahead of her competitors.
meanings.sent2: The spy moved outwiles through the crowd, blending in seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks outwiles, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The ninja moved outwiles in the shadows, unseen by his enemies.
meanings.sent5: The hacker outwiles bypassed the security system, gaining access to confidential information.
